PageTitle: ipv6 nd miss anti-attack rate-limit source-ip
FuncDef:
The ipv6 nd miss anti-attack rate-limit source-ip command configures a rate limit for receiving ND Miss messages based on a specified source IPv6 address, that is, the number of ND Miss messages that can be processed per second based on a specified source IPv6 address.
The undo ipv6 nd miss anti-attack rate-limit source-ip command restores the default configuration. The ipv6 nd miss anti-attack rate-limit source-ip command configures a rate limit for receiving ND Miss messages based on a specified source IPv6 address, that is, the number of ND Miss messages that can be processed per second based on a specified source IPv6 address. The undo ipv6 nd miss anti-attack rate-limit source-ip command restores the default configuration. By default, no rate limit for receiving ND Miss messages based on a specified source IPv6 address is configured. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
CLIs: ipv6 nd miss anti-attack rate-limit source-ip <ipv6-address> maximum <max-value>
undo ipv6 nd miss anti-attack rate-limit source-ip <ipv6-address> maximum <max-value>

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a rate limit for receiving ND Miss messages based on a specified source IPv6 address.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 5000, in messages per second.

Sets a rate limit for receiving ND Miss messages.
-

Specifies a source IPv6 address for limiting the rate of ND Miss messages.
The value is a 32-digit hexadecimal number, in the format of X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Examples: [~HUAWEI] ipv6 nd miss anti-attack rate-limit source-ip 2001:db8:1::1 maximum 550
ExtraInfo: If a device is attacked, it receives a large number of ND Miss messages within a short period. As a result, the device consumes many CPU resources to learn and respond to ND entries, affecting the processing of other services. To resolve this issue, configure a rate limit for receiving ND Miss messages based on a specified source IPv6 address. After the configuration is complete, the device counts the number of ND Miss messages received per period based on the specified source IPv6 address. If the number exceeds the configured limit, the device does not process excess ND Miss messages.
